However, the service was nice hence the 3 stars.

review_full: As some reviewers pointed out, this is not a fine dining place. But Everyone in the restaurant is nice, Food is very reasonable and most people ended up getting a great time there. Also, it is a sharp contrast from generally rich Madrid food and people will no doubt look for a change. They also speak better English most Spanish places. We tried grilled blood sausage as appetizer, salad is plenty and also tried Argentinian crapes and all quite good. More like comfort food in terms of presentation. Also tried pork ribs and Argentinian beef. Their style of grilling is a bit bland but quite good to eat with side like fries. Best beef, I ever had, of course not but nobody will complain with this price range.

review_full: El Sur de Huertas is an excellent Spanish restaurant/bodega to try some paella and tapas in Madrid. Food is very well presented and the nightly service team that waited our table was perfect, they provided great recommendations and were very attentive. The paella is sufficiently large for two people to share if you‚Äôre not extremely hungry and want to try something else on the menu. FYI for families, the place itself is sufficiently large for a stroller which is not a given at many places in Madrid. Overall, decently priced, authentic, and not overly touristy place with great service that definitely deserves a shot.

review_preview: I am very leery of reviewers that sing praises and have written only one or two reviews. I would be suspicious.  In my opinion it is indeed an outstanding restaurant. I will sing praises and have written many reviews!  We ate here twice during a...
review_full: I am very leery of reviewers that sing praises and have written only one or two reviews. I would be suspicious. In my opinion it is indeed an outstanding restaurant. I will sing praises and have written many reviews! We ate here twice during a 3 day visit. The first time we were able to have the menu del dia - what a deal! For 21 Euros we had white wine, caprese salad, a creamy vegetable soup, a paella like rice dish, pork and potatoes. We don't eat wheat so we passed on the bread and had tea and coffee instead of dessert. The food was outstanding and the service was too.  We went back the next day, a holiday, when there was no menu del dia, and had media raciones of ropa vieja and potatoes, 2 kinds of risotto, roasted vegetables, and wine for 27.70 Euros. We had ordered too much food but it was so so good. The restaurant was crazy busy and we still had fantastic service.

title_review: Nice Menu del Dia - Good Service
review_preview: We came across this place when looking for somewhere to go for our last Menu del Dia in Madrid. The menu board posted outside was inviting due to the offerings and price point - only ‚Ç¨10.50 for a three-course meal including wine. Plus, the reviews...
review_full: We came across this place when looking for somewhere to go for our last Menu del Dia in Madrid. The menu board posted outside was inviting due to the offerings and price point - only ‚Ç¨10.50 for a three-course meal including wine. Plus, the reviews seemed very promising! We felt welcomed from the moment we walked in and enjoyed looking at the all of the movie posters that decorated their walls. As it turns out, my daughter and I ordered the exact same things - a starter of surprisingly delicious Revuelto de Gambas (scrambled eggs with shrimp), a main of Tabla de Verduras con Queso Brie (roasted veggies plate with brie), and cheesecake for dessert. Overall, everything was very tasty- especially the eggs with shrimp and veggie plate! The cheesecake was good but not super special - I would probably try something else for dessert if we ever go back.

I got the penne (with the spicy sauce and Italian sausage): one of the best pastas I have ever tried! I really really recommend this place. Pro tip: Get the biscotti for desert :P I normally only review places when they are either too bad or very good. This one is a very good example of the latter.  100% recommended. 5 stars for this one!

title_review: Great food, great service , beautiful and clean restaurant
review_preview: Visiting Madrid for a weekend we were keen to find a restaurant that serve delicious food, with kind and attentive staff, but one of our key (but often overlooked) criteria is the true cleanliness of the restaurant and it‚Äôs toilets. I often believe that if...
review_full: Visiting Madrid for a weekend we were keen to find a restaurant that serve delicious food, with kind and attentive staff, but one of our key (but often overlooked) criteria is the true cleanliness of the restaurant and it‚Äôs toilets. I often believe that if the toilet is extremely clean then there is a good chance the other areas Such as kitchen will be suitably well maintained. Well this restaurant ticked all the boxes.. the restaurant was clean in all area‚Äôs, the decor and furnishings were stylish and welcoming, the food is cooked in a kitchen that is visible from the restaurant and the chefs look clean and appear very efficient and well motivated in their work, the food we had was of excellent quality and extremely tasty with good sized portions. Finally the service we received from all the servers was excellent and not over the top... special mention to our main server Robert who was excellent (he was their when we needed him but discrete so we were able to enjoy our dinner)... so if you are in Madrid looking for great food, great restaurant environment and great service then give this a go... Thank you

Service fast fun and friendly!

review_preview: We came here late after a long day out and about. Convenient location, right near our hotel. The dining area is small, with tables all next to each other, but we were lucky to sit right away. We ordered the sirloins and they came out...
review_full: We came here late after a long day out and about. Convenient location, right near our hotel. The dining area is small, with tables all next to each other, but we were lucky to sit right away. We ordered the sirloins and they came out perfectly. Tender, perfectly medium (pink not bloody), with very light salt & pepper seasoning. Yum. And just the right size as well. That with a shared portion of potatoes was just fine. The service was good, not super speedy, so diners should be patient. There was only one server, and with a full dining room, she was slammed. It was interesting, at least to me, to see that the staff--chef, server, co-chef--were all women. Do not see that all the time. This was a great dinner, glad we went. Keep your order simple--sirloin, potato, wine.

The restaurant is small so I would strongly advise a reservation if eating later. Enjoy and thank you!

review_preview: We spent two days in Madrid to celebrate my birthday. We went in on Sunday night first. When we arrived the restaurant wasn't busy but we were given seats were the staff was constantly opening the doors behind my back so we asked to be...
review_full: We spent two days in Madrid to celebrate my birthday. We went in on Sunday night first. When we arrived the restaurant wasn't busy but we were given seats were the staff was constantly opening the doors behind my back so we asked to be moved. There was no problem with that. The problem was the service which has absolutely no knowledge about the menu. We asked about the bottle of Champagne and our waitress wasn't able to describe if it was actually dry or any other specification. She said she will ask and walk out. Came back with answer which wasn't to our liking so I asked about the Rose and she needed to go and ask again. Then I asked about the white wine by the glass ( 1 choice! ) and when she said the third time she didn't know I just decided to go ahead with it, well I didn't have a different choice, did I ? We had a full 3 course meal and nobody bothered to ask if we were enjoying our food. By the end of our dinner the restaurant got busy and we needed to ask for dessert menus, then to order and also the bill.  Next day we decided to give them another try because of great location. Waiter was serving, cleaning table and basically doing all the service through railing and didn't even bother to go around. I felt there is a lack of management and training. The only reason why I am giving 3 stars was the food. I would normally never write a bad review but after receiving 3 emails I felt you might want to know.

title_review: Nice atmosphere and good food - but uneven
review_preview: Reading some of the reviews on TripAdvisor we hade quite high expectations. We were 6 friends on a weekend trip in Madrid and this was our first restaurant experience. I think uneven is the best way to describe the experience. Some of the food was...
review_full: Reading some of the reviews on TripAdvisor we hade quite high expectations. We were 6 friends on a weekend trip in Madrid and this was our first restaurant experience. I think uneven is the best way to describe the experience. Some of the food was really good, and some were more mediocre. The atmosphere is quite energetic - so if you are looking for a romantic dinner you do best to avoid this place. But if you're up to a noisy and crowded place this is more up your alley.  Staff was super nice and did their best to make sure we all had a good time. However. the chairs and table were not that comfy and they squeezed in far to many tables in the restaurant so it was very tight.  So all in all a pleasant experience with quite good value for money. We had a good time but there are a lot of as good restaurants in Madrid.

title_review: Yummy break from the Spanish Cuisine
review_preview: My family of 4 went to Oven for dinner.  We love the Spanish cuisine and like all good things we just needed a meal without Jamon Iberico.  I started with the Del Monte salad which was delicious. The flavors were a wonderful mix and I...
review_full: My family of 4 went to Oven for dinner. We love the Spanish cuisine and like all good things we just needed a meal without Jamon Iberico. I started with the Del Monte salad which was delicious. The flavors were a wonderful mix and I was so happy to have a salad that didn't include tuna.  We all had pizza and enjoyed it as well. I've lived in NJ and Chicago which are both places with excellent pizza options so I think I know pizza and while this pizza was different than either of the styles served in NJ and Chicago it was very good. Finally, I would add that it was very good value for the cost.

review_preview: I went to Oven because it was close to my hotel and I needed lunch. We got a seat next to the window, ordered drinks, a salad and pizza. I usually hate salads, always bitter, and boring and gross. The Oven's salad was a surprise...
review_full: I went to Oven because it was close to my hotel and I needed lunch. We got a seat next to the window, ordered drinks, a salad and pizza. I usually hate salads, always bitter, and boring and gross. The Oven's salad was a surprise - spinach greens, perfect blend of honey, vinegar, salt, with mozzarella and tomatoes to top off. Every bite was yummy and I was tempted to ask for more. The pizza was also fantastic (better than pizza I've had in NY or Italy) - crust not too thick or soggy, cheese not too stringy. A perfect casual lunch. I love this place!

title_review: Out of my expectations! Highly recommended!
review_preview: Ending up a day full of business meetings, I was too tired to go out for dinner, and I found out this very well rated restaurant by checking randomly on Google.I phoned the restaurant and informed the gentleman who answered my call what time...
review_full: Ending up a day full of business meetings, I was too tired to go out for dinner, and I found out this very well rated restaurant by checking randomly on Google. I phoned the restaurant and informed the gentleman who answered my call what time I might arrive there by taxi to pick up my order of Insalata Cesare con Pollo and Tagliolini alle Vongole, he confirmed to have it prepared on time. When I arrived at the restaurant to find out that was the owner who took my order, he offered me a glass of prosecco and asked me to wait for 2 minutes, he just wanted to have the tagliolini cooked on the right moment and prepare it as good as it should be. Indeed, it was really as good as the owner assured! The pasta was cooked perfectly and the seafood was fresh. The only negative point and it was my personal problem which I did not request to the restaurant when I placed the order, I consume less salt than the normal people, so, the dish was a little bit salty for me, if you have the same concern, remember to remind the chef about it. I had a chance to observe the environment while I was waiting for my food, it is a very cozy place, good lighting, warm and friendly waiters, very smiley owner (also a chef), tasty food, I only can say, it is a very recommended place to relax and having well-prepared food.  There is also a wall stand where you can find many kinds of dry pasta, spices for sale. As a conclusion, if I go back to Madrid again, I'm sure to go to have dinner at this restaurant!

We got the menu of the day which was really cheap and the food was good. Not the best steak I have ever had but definitely ahead of the curve within this price range. The wine we got with the meal and the desserts were also really good.  You really can't beat this place for a quality lunch for so little money, go and enjoy!

title_review: Fab food, great service, decent price
review_preview: I went here with my wife during our week long stay in Madrid. To be honest, had I not previously read the reviews on TripAdvisor, we would probably have walked past this place. It is quite small and the tables/ furniture is pretty basic. But...
review_full: I went here with my wife during our week long stay in Madrid.  To be honest, had I not previously read the reviews on TripAdvisor, we would probably have walked past this place. It is quite small and the tables/ furniture is pretty basic. But don‚Äôt judge this ‚Äúbook‚Äù by its cover! Once inside we were warmly greeted by Orlando, who provided us with great service throughout the evening. We both ordered the fillet steak and, on Orlando‚Äôs advice, went with a single portion of fries and a salad.  The food was absolutely fabulous, indeed my wife said it was the best she had ever had. It was perfectly cooked and tasted great - no need to spoil it with any dressings! We had a very pleasant bottle of wine with the meal and thoroughly enjoyed the experience. And all for ‚Ç¨50, excellent value.  Well worth a visit if you want a great steak dinner at a decent price.

review_full: I came upon this small place while wandering around in Gran Via- and I'm glad I did! As mentioned, the place is quite small, yet- atmospheric. The music is entertaining, yet its volume never exceeds that of ambient music, leaving allowing for a great relaxed mood to enjoy the food. In addition, the food is great! I ended up going there three times, in which I tasted a different option of the menu- recommend the morcillas and the skirt steak. The dessert is also pretty good . Finally, and most importantly, the waiters are quite courteous and the owner is a really nice guy- worth having a quick chat with him if he's not too busy. Overall great experience. Would definitely recommend!

Found both in abundance in El Sur, the kitchen provided just what we needed in terms of small, unusual and filling plates. Frank, Miguel and Rebecca filled our soul and that of our daughter. Too often on our travels through Europe we resort to the Golden Arches to satisfy the conservative palate of our young daughter. Fill her belly then we can relax with a glass of beer or wine. Not today however, the ‚Äúsecret beef‚Äù captured Ren‚Äôs imagination as well as ours, the prawns almost defeated Pammy, me.....a small glass of beer, bread, olive oil... a father needs only keep his girls happy ! Three visits in 4 days is justified by the service alone , good grub in a small, busy environment with good coffee, beer and wine will ensure our return on our next visit to Madrid.

title_review: Very nice little place with great food and service
review_preview: I went to the other El Sur which isn't too far away from this one and was very happy with it. So we decided to try out this OK ne as well. It seems they have a wider range of dishes.We had the huevos...
review_full: I went to the other El Sur which isn't too far away from this one and was very happy with it. So we decided to try out this OK ne as well. It seems they have a wider range of dishes. We had the huevos rotos which were just as outstanding as the other El Sur. Highly recommend. We also ordered grilled prawns. They arrived a little undercooked but after pointing it out to Eddy (our very jolly and welcoming waiter), he immediately took it back to the kitchen. Minutes later it returned perfectly cooked and they were excellent. Alongside it came a nicely seasoned salad. We also had pimentos padron.  The sangria by the glass is also very good. Quite refreshing, tasty and not too sweet (like some other sangria tended to be). Around 35 euros for it all. Well priced considering the quantity and quality. More than happy to dine there again.

review_preview: Really enjoyed this restaurant.  I've eaten my way through a half dozen Spanish cities and this little spot is among the top 5 for me.  I didn't give five stars because i don't feel the meal was perfect but extremely close.  Cool vibe, buzzing and...
review_full: Really enjoyed this restaurant. I've eaten my way through a half dozen Spanish cities and this little spot is among the top 5 for me. I didn't give five stars because i don't feel the meal was perfect but extremely close. Cool vibe, buzzing and a nice mix of locals and tourists. We ordered their ropa vieja 1/2 order tapa, verduras a la plancha (grilled veggies) with goat cheese and a special Paella, (we ordered reluctantly as I tend not to eat paella outside Valencia.) All three were extremely flavorful. Great portion sizes and the paella surprisingly didn't disappoint. I would have loved some caramelization on the rice but I know it was a special and I'm nitpicking admittedly. The star of the show however was by far the veggies. Perfectly seasoned and the cheese set the dish off right. We ordered vase of sangria and it was pretty damn good.

title_review: Best meal I had in Madrid!
review_preview: We went here on our last night in Madrid. We made a reservation for 9:30 the day before via email and I‚Äôm happy we did as there was a 30 min wait otherwise... (10PM+ is just too late for me...) As soon as we walked...
review_full: We went here on our last night in Madrid. We made a reservation for 9:30 the day before via email and I‚Äôm happy we did as there was a 30 min wait otherwise... (10PM+ is just too late for me...) As soon as we walked in we were greeted by Andres. He was very funny and friendly. We were seated at a table in the front window of the restaurant... my husband is 6‚Äô4‚Äù... and he was a little too large for this area, so they let us move to a high top table. Some of the menus here in Madrid have been hard to order from, but this menu was easy to read and know what you were getting. In true American fashion... we ordered too much food but we really wanted to try a few things on the menu. We ordered the Moussaka, empanadas, seafood paella and a beef special. Everything that came out of the kitchen was hot and very tastey. I would recommend this place to anyone visiting Madrid.

review_preview: Do not resist an opportunity to experience Lumbini in Madrid.Excellent Indian food, from vegetarian to meat.. This visit to Lumbini will be remembered for life.... It was late in the evening and the restaurant was closing but Gagan the manager probably saw us and...
review_full: Do not resist an opportunity to experience Lumbini in Madrid. Excellent Indian food, from vegetarian to meat.. This visit to Lumbini will be remembered for life.... It was late in the evening and the restaurant was closing but Gagan the manager probably saw us and welcomed us in. WOW!!!! what an amazing experience. It was best unplanned and will be an unforgettable birthday. Not only was the food amazing, he was able to play all of our requests of Bollywood music and dancing from our group, but I must say the service was superb. Before we know it, he showed up with a special cake he made although he was about to close for the night. His creation was absolutely beautiful with Kulfi, whip cream and an apple sliced very thin. What a beauty for just having a few minutes to spare because we kept him extremely busy. We had an exquisite time and the food was delicious.

title_review: A great evening with Excellent food, Great people, Wonderful vives..
review_preview: Wondering around this part of Madrid, my colleague and me walked in here for a working lunch and BOY ! we were surprised. The food was absolute homely, delicious and  perfectly accompanied by the Local Sangria. Served with utmost passion and care that spoke very...
review_full: Wondering around this part of Madrid, my colleague and me walked in here for a working lunch and BOY ! we were surprised. The food was absolute homely, delicious and perfectly accompanied by the Local Sangria. Served with utmost passion and care that spoke very high of the customer service standards. Gagan and Joshi were very attentive, prompt and always had the best in menu to suggest. Angel was great fun with his choice of menu from the Bar ! Went out satisfied, surprised and content only to return for dinner with my wife and we had a gala time with these beautiful bunch of people. Great food, great company, and the pataran (hope I got the spelling right) was the cherry on the top. Try it if you have not yet in Spain. Amazing experience that I feel now very happy about sharing. Thanks to Gagan, Joshi and Angel. Keep up the good work guys...  Finding a place with great food is awesome. But with people who can make your evening a memorable one with their service, with their care, their story, its priceless.... We have new friends in Madrid now.. HOLA LUMBINI !!

At the end of the meal, we were served shots of pineapple rum. What a nice treat.  What made our dinner even more special was our server, Juan. He couldn't have been any more accommodating. He made sure everything was perfect.  For a great steak and great service, this is definitely the place to come.

review_preview: First off, to any of you looking for a menu... We've got you.  Now let the review begin: Go here. If you are in Madrid and you don't go here, you've made a mistake.  The wait staff is friendly, attentive, and efficient (a rarity in...
review_full: First off, to any of you looking for a menu... We've got you.  Now let the review begin: Go here. If you are in Madrid and you don't go here, you've made a mistake. The wait staff is friendly, attentive, and efficient (a rarity in Spain), and even gave us a shot of limoncello free of charge. Whatever staton or mix they had playing was full of upbeat classics, which everyone seemed to enjoy. The food was fantastic; the patatas bravas were tasty, just the right amount of spice. The chicken rolls were great as well, and the Cuban flank steak was unique and mouth-watering. One of the biggest standouts among this homerun of a meal was the sangria. The sangria was light and refreshing, by far the best sangria we have ever tasted.  The kicker is that all of the food and drinks were very reasonably priced. We cannot recommend this highly enough. Go there, have a good time and great food, and when you think of Madrid, you will think of this restaurant.

title_review: Subpar meat quality and slow service
review_preview: The place is small and tends to fill up. Around 9pm there was a small crowd waiting outside (you cannot wait inside), at 10pm it was better. The lomo was OK but clearly had too much fat and a place that gives itself an Argentinean/Uruguayan...
review_full: The place is small and tends to fill up. Around 9pm there was a small crowd waiting outside (you cannot wait inside), at 10pm it was better. The lomo was OK but clearly had too much fat and a place that gives itself an Argentinean/Uruguayan feel should have chimichurri sauce, which they didn't. Service was friendly but inefficient. It is Ok to wait for the food, but it took far too long to even bring the drinks. Overall this place looks like a streetfood place and would still be an option for a fast steak, if only it would be - well- fast. Beer from the tap was good though. Better alternatives: De Maria, just behind Callao, provides good value for money with a real Argentinean feel to it.

review_preview: We used Trip Advisor to find Taberna El Sur de Huertas which was located very close to our hotel (Urban). We didn't make a reservation and the restaurant was moderately full (about half?) when we arrived at 5pm. The service is attentive, smiley, tactile and...
review_full: We used Trip Advisor to find Taberna El Sur de Huertas which was located very close to our hotel (Urban). We didn't make a reservation and the restaurant was moderately full (about half?) when we arrived at 5pm.  The service is attentive, smiley, tactile and so, so friendly. The guys working there obviously enjoy what they are doing and this is reflected in their passion and enthusiasm for their food and their reputation. The food is everything that has been stated before; I had hummus and Mr B had ham croquettes to start. I then had wok noodles with veg and Mr B had "Beef Secret" with some potato wedges and their "secret" sauce.  What I liked about this restaurant is that they wanted you to have a nice time above their desire to make money. For example, they suggested that the choices we were making may have been a challenge to finish and recommended half portions! Other restaurants I've been to would have let you purchase the lot and bin the waste!! This beautiful experience was rounded off with a jug of sangria (get a glass instead of a jug as you lose the decorative effect with a jug - the glasses that we saw being brought out were beverage works of art!!!) All this for just under 50 euro - wonderful. I had to keep dragging myself past for the remainder of our 5 night break and no where else we ate lived up to this brilliant experience. Keep doing what you're doing Taberna El Sur de Huertas!!

title_review: Great value steak restaurant just off Gran Via
review_preview: I did what most of you do, search in my neighborhood on TripAdvisor and this came up.At a couple of hundred meters from my hotel I walked past to check it out and it looked nice. It is a small unassuming modern restaurant with...
review_full: I did what most of you do, search in my neighborhood on TripAdvisor and this came up. At a couple of hundred meters from my hotel I walked past to check it out and it looked nice. It is a small unassuming modern restaurant with a few tables, seats at the bar and a few seats outside.  The service is friendly and fast where they speak Spanish and English. The menu is straightforward centered around steaks with some starters, salads and burgers. This is accompanied with a small drinks menu at very reasonable prices. The salad and the steak I had were very good. It was a very nice place and I would recommend it. Definitely better value than the places you find on Gran Via.

review_full: Top tip: Go for an early dinner between 6-8pm - 10 euros for a very delicious 3-course meal with wine!  Food - Excellent. I ordered spicy sausages for starters and a grilled steak for my main course. Both very delicious and juicy, flavoured and cooked to perfection. Served hot and fresh. Had strawberry ice-cream for dessert which was a nice way to end a very good meal. Service - Very good. The waiters were very friendly and patient and spoke good English. We were there at about 7pm so there weren't many people and we were served very promptly. Atmosphere - Very good. Very central location, but a nice place to sit and have a long dinner whilst watching the crowd. Not too noisy or packed. Overall - Fantastic value for money. Definitely worth a try! We would be back in a heartbeat - it was too good a deal!

title_review: Delicious Italian food great for Lunch
review_preview: We came across Oven Mozzarella Bar by accident and I am really glad we did! The food was exceptional - there was a good choice of salads, pasta and pizza and the waiters/waitresses were very attentive.We opted for the classic mozarella salad which was...
review_full: We came across Oven Mozzarella Bar by accident and I am really glad we did! The food was exceptional - there was a good choice of salads, pasta and pizza and the waiters/waitresses were very attentive. We opted for the classic mozarella salad which was fresh and tasty. For mains we got the papardelle al telefono (would recommend for vegetarians) and rigatoni al horno. Before our mains arrived the waitress left a pot on the table containing a generous amount of grated parmesan cheese. The portion sizes were perfect and priced very well for the location. Great for lunchtime or as an early dinner.

Everything was delicious and it was worth waiting 15 minutes to sit inside as the air conditioning was good. We sat at the bar and seeing one of the staff pouring Estrella draft beer into some glasses made me want to try it, it was pretty god also. The staff was really nice and made our experience even better offering free popocorn when we arrived as well as bread with chimichurri sauce, plus a dose of Baileys after we finished our meal, superb!!

title_review: If you like meat this is the place for you.
review_preview: Just lying off Gran Via this tiny restaurant is a first come first serve basis. You can sit inside or out on high stools or conventional seating. We waited outside for 10 minutes until they could accommodate us. Don't be put off by waiting a...
review_full: Just lying off Gran Via this tiny restaurant is a first come first serve basis. You can sit inside or out on high stools or conventional seating. We waited outside for 10 minutes until they could accommodate us. Don't be put off by waiting a while because it will be worth it. Our waiter Lucas from Argentina was friendly and professional and spoke perfect English. They give everyone a steel tub of salted popcorn for an appetiser which we found unusual. We had a cesar salad to start which was lovely but the star of the show is what most people who dine here come for is the black Angus steak. It was fantastic. We'll definitely make a return visit when we come back to Madrid.

review_preview: Following our research on Trip Advisor, we decided to try out Mu! El Placer De La Carne. As two couples we found ourselves in the queue and supposedly 10 minutes from being seated. Amazingly, 10 minutes later we were seated in this tiny little restaurant...
review_full: Following our research on Trip Advisor, we decided to try out Mu! El Placer De La Carne. As two couples we found ourselves in the queue and supposedly 10 minutes from being seated. Amazingly, 10 minutes later we were seated in this tiny little restaurant which, whilst basically furnished, was well air conditioned and has excellent acoustics - which is a huge plus in my book. The service was prompt, friendly and not in the least bit pushy. From there, things only got better - the food is what it's all about. Simple, delicious and well worth the 10 minutes spent queuing.

review_preview: This restaurant was a Godsend!  We have a fussy seven-year old who likes to dine early and in Madrid most restaurants do not seem to open before 8 pm.  Oven Gran Via seems to be one of the few places in the city that are...
review_full: This restaurant was a Godsend! We have a fussy seven-year old who likes to dine early and in Madrid most restaurants do not seem to open before 8 pm. Oven Gran Via seems to be one of the few places in the city that are open throughout the afternoon. We arrived at around 6 pm and there were only two other customers there. The menu was mostly pasta and pizza, which was perfect for us - my wife is also vegetarian. I couldn't fault the food; it was exactly what we wanted and of a high standard. The home-made tiramisu was excellent. Prices were also very fair.

The Restaurant was normally not our kind of restaurant, not due to the food but more to the more modern still of the restaurant. The food though was just great, maybe the best Spanish tapas I have ever tasted and I have been in many tapas places all over spain.  The food was very delicious an I would recommend everyone to visit this restruarant and do not be intimidated by the modern still, after 5 minutes of adopting to the stile, it was actually a very cool place. We ended up the a jar of sangaria 1L, and 5 different tapas menues recommended by the waiter, and paid 40 EUR which was very cheap when you considered the quality of the food.

title_review: Great cheese, salads and food. Awesome service as well.
review_preview: After a cultural walk in Chueca and Malasa√±a we ended up in Oven Mozzarela. We got lucky: the restaurant is very comfortable and the service was excellent. They can serve in both English and Spanish, are always very meticulous and sympathic, explaining every plate and...
review_full: After a cultural walk in Chueca and Malasa√±a we ended up in Oven Mozzarela. We got lucky: the restaurant is very comfortable and the service was excellent. They can serve in both English and Spanish, are always very meticulous and sympathic, explaining every plate and giving suggestions.  We ended up loving the ensaladas, mozzarelas and burratas. All in all, every one in the table (five of us) loved the food and had a great time. The "La Tavola" (chesseplate with ham and a incredible pesto sauce) is a great way to taste some of their specialities. For dessert (postre) the suggestion was a warm biscuit with icecream (Biscotti al horno) that some of us thought was the BEST DESSERT EVER! It will make you wanna come back.

review_preview: Our hotel recommended Inclan. Usually, I‚Äôm skeptical of hotel recommended places but Inclan was fabulous. Located on a small side street, Inclan is named after the writer and dramatist, Ramon del Valle-Inclan. The decor is eclectic but the ceiling motif of huge feather pens and...
review_full: Our hotel recommended Inclan. Usually, I‚Äôm skeptical of hotel recommended places but Inclan was fabulous. Located on a small side street, Inclan is named after the writer and dramatist, Ramon del Valle-Inclan. The decor is eclectic but the ceiling motif of huge feather pens and nibs is a homage to Inclan. The menu was a bit hard to decipher at first but we plunged in not completely sure what was coming in the way of food but, wow, what great surprise when the Caesar salad arrived completely deconstructed. The fabulous waiter then trimmed the greens from a potted salad, mixed in the ingredients and voila a wonderful Caesar. We then had artichoke risotto, wonderful , and scallops. THe presentation of scallops is on a large plate with he scallops on the half shell. They are seared at the table. Excellent. A note: may be slightly underdone for some diners. FInally, we had two bao. These are presented in an adorable ceramic panda. Fabulous presentation and great tasting.  Loved it!

review_preview: We stopped at this restaurant for lunch around 1 pm.  As it was our first time vacationing in Madrid, we chose to use Trip Advisor.  This restaurant received a great rating and was within a very walkable distance to us following an excellent 3 hour...
review_full: We stopped at this restaurant for lunch around 1 pm. As it was our first time vacationing in Madrid, we chose to use Trip Advisor. This restaurant received a great rating and was within a very walkable distance to us following an excellent 3 hour Context Tour of Madrid. We did not have a reservation, but our party of 4 was seated pretty quickly at a long table in the rear of the restaurant. We chose to eat an ‚Äúall-inclusive‚Äù meal (drink, several dishes, and a dessert) called Evolucion Tapas. EVERY unusual dish was amazingly delicious and beautifully presented!!! I won‚Äôt go into the details because I don‚Äôt want to spoil your experience should you choose to dine here. But, it‚Äôs high rating is well deserved! The restaurant was full and people were waiting for tables to open at the entrance when we left 1-1/2 hours later...and for good reason. If the Inclan Brutal Bar is right for you, make a reservation or come early...we were lucky to get a table so quickly.

review_full: We've been travelling around Europe for the past 3 weeks and tonight was definitely one of our most wonderful experiences. From the minute we walked in the staff (all of them!) set the stage for an incredible night. They clearly love their restaurant and the people who come to enjoy their food. They are warm, generous, fun and funny. The environment is a complete joy to be in and the tables were filled from front to back with couples and families. We sat at a table by the bar and were surrounded by incredible people from all sides, that took great care of us. Our kids are kind of picky eaters (although they're 18 and 15) and there was something for everyone. And not only was all of the food really great, but it was paired with literally the most delicious and beautiful sangria you've ever seen. Get it by the glass to see how gorgeous it is however after one sip you'll want it by the pitcher.

title_review: Great food, friendly service at very reasonable prices
review_preview: The food choices in Madrid can be overwhelming, but you can't go wrong at El Sur.    We found this place randomly walking in 40c  heat one evening last week.   You know how it goes;  you're hot, hungry and lacking direction and you want to make...
review_full: The food choices in Madrid can be overwhelming, but you can't go wrong at El Sur. We found this place randomly walking in 40c heat one evening last week. You know how it goes; you're hot, hungry and lacking direction and you want to make the RIGHT choice for dinner -- well we're glad we found El Sur. My son checked out the reviews on TA and it looked good. Place is unassuming, but the food is absolutely amazing! Tapas -- Grilled veggies, seafood paella, curry chicken with walnuts and raisins and cod with goat cheese and Honey ... God I miss this place. They offer full and half plates and that's great for sharing. The Sangria alone is worth stopping in for. Giselle and Ruben were very friendly and attentive. It's so nice to have people who are patient with Americans who speak limited Spanish. Please open another one in my small town in the Northeast USA! Hope to get there again some time.

review_full: Not only is the food terrific, but the service is top-notch! When I told our server, Andres that although I loved squid and octopus, I had had a great deal of these over the last several days and really wanted grilled fish, he arranged for me to have the menu del dia, which normally is only served until 4 PM. It was after 8 PM, and he was able to bring me delicious grilled tuna ( a la plancha), along with salad for an incredible price. The sangria was also fabulous, with lots of fresh fruit. My husband loved his dish as well. This is a small place, off the beaten path, and well worth finding! We will definitely return!Andres--estoy muy agradecido por todo tu ayude!

title_review: Great food, not so great service
review_preview: Having walked past earlier in the day we thought we would give it a go.We were sat upstairs, the decor looked good.The problems started with getting a menu, we waited ages and had to ask a few times, then only got one between...
review_full: Having walked past earlier in the day we thought we would give it a go. We were sat upstairs, the decor looked good. The problems started with getting a menu, we waited ages and had to ask a few times, then only got one between the two of us. The waiter said he would get another, but didn't. When we ordered my wife ordered her starter and main, I don't think he expected her to do that as he found it difficult to understand that I would order after her, he kept asking if we wanted to share. Eventually we managed to convince him we wanted a meal each. Next someone else came to us with a glass of white wine, we had ordered a bottle of red. They went round every table to ask who had ordered the wine until they found the person who had. This happened every time food was brought out. They would go from table to table until they found the right one. When the waiter came with our bottle of wine he had trouble opening it, he wandered off after seeming to hear something in the earpiece they wore, he went off and started talking to his colleagues and we had to attract his attention to get him to come back. We found we always had to ask at least twice and usually more than one member of staff before they would see what we wanted. They were easily distracted and would leave in the middle of serving you to do something else and forget to come back to you. Other reviews have praised the service, so I guess we were unlucky that night. (17 October 2016) The food was great, we started with baked aubergine in tomato and mozzarella and a platter with meats and cheeses. Both outstanding. For mains we had prawn filled ravioli and lobster filled larger ravioli ( can't remember the name of the pasta). Really nice. For sweet we had tiramisu which was good and a baked biscuit/cookie covered in a chocolate sauce with ice cream, which my wife thought was the best desert she has had. All this and a bottle of red wine was ‚Ç¨75  It seems a lovely place and the food was terrific, but the service was comical and made it difficult to enjoy the evening.
